column9: Initiative from the undisclosed GRI (found by the coder but not mentioned in the GRI index table)

column13: In the interim, Carsales will transition the fuel usage of its fleet from gasoline and diesel to unleaded gasoline with an E10 blend. In the next two years, 30% of Carsales' fleet will use E10 blend. In the next five years, 50% of the fleet will use E10 blend. In the next 5Ã¢ÂÂ7 years, 80% of the fleet will use E10 blend.

column6: Energy consumption outside of the organization

column13: Carsales is investigating the feasibility of switching to green energy and carbon-neutral electricity in its offices across Australia. Carsales hopes to transition to this in a phased approach over the next 1-3 years.

column6: Reductions in energy requirements of products and services

column7: Carsales' scope 1 emissions in 2023 were 185.6 tCO2e.
Carsales' scope 3 emissions in 2023 were 487 tCO2e.
Carsales' scope 3 emissions in 2023 were 7,016.9 tCO2e.
Carsales' emissions intensity in 2023 was 10.5 tCO2e.

column13: Carsales' current emissions reduction strategy outlines its commitment to reducing its Australian business operations' emissions intensity by 30 per cent per FTE by 2030 compared to its FY22 baseline. Carsales plans to achieve this through reducing Scope 1 and 2 intensity by 100 per cent and Scope 3 intensity emissions by 20 per cent.
column20: Emissions reduction strategy, emissions intensity, Scope 1, Scope 2, Scope 3

column13: Carsales will review its travel policies and, where possible, continue to use technology to connect, thus avoiding unnecessary travel and associated environmental impacts. Carsales estimates this will reduce travel by 20%. Carsales also aims to work with its external travel management provider to ascertain where and how it can travel sustainability and offset emissions during travel. Offsetting Carsales' flights will reduce 3.9% of its scope 3 emissions.
column20: Travel policy, environmental impact, travel management provider

column13: Carsales will encourage its employees, where possible, to switch to public transport, car-pooling, cycling or walking. At the Melbourne head office, Carsales has end-of-trip facilities for its team, and its location is well connected to many bike paths, making riding to work an attractive option. Carsales also offers its Victorian team the ability to buy discounted 365-day Myki passes through the Myki Commuter Club to encourage its employees to use public transport. It will reduce 20% of emissions from employee commutes.

column6: Nitrogen oxides (NOx), sulfur oxides (SOx), and other significant air emissions
Waste generation and significant waste-related impacts
column13: Carsales partnered with Tyre Stewardship Australia. The partnership seeks to effectively reduce passenger tyres' environmental, health and safety impacts, which reach the end of their life in Australia each year. It also aims to develop viable markets for these end-of-life (worn out) tyres, including those sold by Carsales' tyres business.
column20: Tyre Stewardship Australia, environmental impact, end-of-life tyre

column6: Waste generation and significant waste-related impacts
column13: Carsales plans to audit its landfill waste to identify if anything else could be recycled. Carsales will also go further to implement circular economy principles and target to recycle waste and reuse and repair what it can to avoid e-waste where possible. It will reduce Carsales' waste emissions by 50% by 2030.\t

column6: Waste generation and significant waste-related impacts
column13: In Australia, Carsales aims to achieve the complete reuse of electronic waste. Approximately 85 per cent of Carsales' e-waste continues to be redistributed. Carsales either allows employees to purchase these items for a nominal fee, which is donated to charity or seeks to reuse old but serviceable computers, laptops and screens by providing them to local community groups after hard drives have been wiped.

column7: Carsales generated 118.6 tonnes of waste in 2023.

column6: Non-compliance with environmental laws and regulations
column7: Carsales did not incur any fines or sanctions for non-compliance with environmental laws in 2023.

column6: New suppliers that were screened using environmental criteria
column7: Carsales screened 68 new suppliers using environmental criteria in 2023.

column6: Negative environmental impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
New employee hires and employee turnover
column7: Carsales' employee turnover in Australia was 14%.

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column13: This year, Carsalees ran a series of workshops and interviews with stakeholders across the business to understand their lived employee experience better and unearth what excites them and their teams about working for Carsales. Carsales used insights from these conversations to refresh its approach in the market and provide potential candidates with a deeper understanding of what it's like to work for Carsales and the opportunities that exist if they choose to join Carsales' team.
